commit_message:
Use the mocking fixture in notifier tests

All the notifier tests end up mocking out the notifier object so lets
just do it once for all tests.

This also splits out the test that tries to use the logging notifier
because it's a different setup.

Change-Id: I159a2d34fe833b0bbac70c41d521bbe1dccbc09c

revisions:

1) Bump RDO repository to the first consistent Ocata repository.
2) Adding lbaasv2 service plugin into Neutron, required to execute
   LBaaS tests.
3) Disabling Designate on RDO, it miss a new Monasca dependency.

Change-Id: Ib1c6144bd248c482f9dfe6d4ef6eab5c1a0a986d
'}]
commit_message:
Align the stars to bump RDO to Ocata

1) Bump RDO repository to the first consistent Ocata repository.
2) Adding lbaasv2 service plugin into Neutron, required to execute
   LBaaS tests.
3) Disabling Designate on RDO, it miss a new Monasca dependency.

Change-Id: Ib1c6144bd248c482f9dfe6d4ef6eab5c1a0a986d

subject: Limit memory & CPU when running qemu-img info
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1736, 'name': 'Ivan Kolodyazhny', 'email': 'e0ne@e0ne.info', 'username': 'e0ne'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 7173, 'name': 'Scott DAngelo', 'email': 'scott.dangelo@gmail.com', 'username': 'scottda'}, {'_account_id': 9535, 'name': 'Gorka Eguileor', 'email': 'geguileo@redhat.com', 'username': 'Gorka'}, {'_account_id': 10058, 'name': 'Erlon R. Cruz', 'email': 'erlon.rodrigues.cruz@canonical.com', 'username': 'sombrafam'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-23 17:05:20.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/apply-limits-to-qemu-img-29f722a1bf4b91f8.yaml', 'cinder/image/image_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_image_utils.py'], 'message': "Limit memory & CPU when running qemu-img info

It was found that a modified or corrupted image file can cause a DoS
on the host when getting image info with qemu-img.

This uses the newer 'prlimit' parameter for oslo.concurrency execute
to set an address space limit of 1GB and CPU time limit of 2 seconds
when running the qemu-img info command.

Change-Id: If5b7129b266ef065642bc7898ce9dcf93722a053
Closes-bug: #1449062
(cherry picked from commit 8547444775e406a50d9d26a0003e9ba6554b0d70)
"}]
commit_message:
Limit memory & CPU when running qemu-img info

It was found that a modified or corrupted image file can cause a DoS
on the host when getting image info with qemu-img.

This uses the newer 'prlimit' parameter for oslo.concurrency execute
to set an address space limit of 1GB and CPU time limit of 2 seconds
when running the qemu-img info command.

Change-Id: If5b7129b266ef065642bc7898ce9dcf93722a053
Closes-bug: #1449062
(cherry picked from commit 8547444775e406a50d9d26a0003e9ba6554b0d70)

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-27 20:25:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_guest.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/guest.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Clean up libvirt guest code

Libvirt's function blockJobInfo returns structure with info about operation on
block device. In this structure there current and final value to indicate
current and final cursor position for operation, value of bandwidth for
operation and type of operation. All of those values are integer values and
can't be unset. Because of that there is no need to get those values with
specified defaults in BlockDevice.get_job_info() method.

Change-Id: I597f15cf330e192b7ad88549c8dfc2f52b13df57
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up libvirt guest code

Libvirt's function blockJobInfo returns structure with info about operation on
block device. In this structure there current and final value to indicate
current and final cursor position for operation, value of bandwidth for
operation and type of operation. All of those values are integer values and
can't be unset. Because of that there is no need to get those values with
specified defaults in BlockDevice.get_job_info() method.

Change-Id: I597f15cf330e192b7ad88549c8dfc2f52b13df57

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-28 14:25:52.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_context/tests/test_context.py', 'oslo_context/context.py'], 'message': "Add is_admin_project check

Keystone now has two configuration values:
   admin_project_name
   admin_project_domain_name

If both values are set, and tokens requested for projects
(only, not domains) that match both will have an additional
value in them;

   `is_admin_project=true`

THis value is indicates that the token can be used for operations that
are considered 'administrative' and which, in the past, only required.
The 'admin' role.  This added check allows the services to
independantly close https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/968696 but
int order to do so, they need to be able to enforce policy against
this field.


Change-Id: I81a9a9f46a65f667002a61ad39cc6240c30114dc
"}]
commit_message:
Add is_admin_project check

Keystone now has two configuration values:
   admin_project_name
   admin_project_domain_name

If both values are set, and tokens requested for projects
(only, not domains) that match both will have an additional
value in them;

   `is_admin_project=true`

THis value is indicates that the token can be used for operations that
are considered 'administrative' and which, in the past, only required.
The 'admin' role.  This added check allows the services to
independantly close https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/968696 but
int order to do so, they need to be able to enforce policy against
this field.


Change-Id: I81a9a9f46a65f667002a61ad39cc6240c30114dc

subject: Remove workaround for bad pycparser wheel
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-05 16:32:49.000000000', 'files': ['test-vars.yml'], 'message': 'Remove workaround for bad pycparser wheel

This reverts https://review.openstack.org/381007 now that the
root cause of the issue [1] has been resolved, and that the
upper-constraints for OpenStack have been updated [2] to work
around the issue.

It also adds a clearer explanation for the reason why
libvirt-python is not installed via a wheel in tests.

[1] https://github.com/eliben/pycparser/issues/147
[2] https://review.openstack.org/381011

Change-Id: I2a4e75d952d4218fa7a0847e6fbf8f6afc15a65b
(cherry picked from commit 783709a84e7abf69cc8c7174dc3467d776c00063)

commit_message:
Remove workaround for bad pycparser wheel

This reverts https://review.openstack.org/381007 now that the
root cause of the issue [1] has been resolved, and that the
upper-constraints for OpenStack have been updated [2] to work
around the issue.

It also adds a clearer explanation for the reason why
libvirt-python is not installed via a wheel in tests.

[1] https://github.com/eliben/pycparser/issues/147
[2] https://review.openstack.org/381011

Change-Id: I2a4e75d952d4218fa7a0847e6fbf8f6afc15a65b
(cherry picked from commit 783709a84e7abf69cc8c7174dc3467d776c00063)

revisions:

commit_message:
Use empty list for None values in repeat function

Atrributes would return `None` before the resource is
created, hence resource validation would fail when
using repeat function. Use empty list instead to avoid
it.

Change-Id: I93f65d6604944ccae40f65ef52754dcec69e9886
Closes-Bug: #1629899

subject: Fix rc.local for systemd in nodepool-base element
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-05 12:47:24.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/nodepool-base/finalise.d/89-unbound'], 'message': "Fix rc.local for systemd in nodepool-base element

Having non-shebang first line (empty one) leads to error on Xenial,
because systemd can't execute scripts without shebang, and rc.local
is not run (`status=203/EXEC`).

Change-Id: Icc2f01b89e6d582ad015009f6916379bee8af7b9
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rc.local for systemd in nodepool-base element

Having non-shebang first line (empty one) leads to error on Xenial,
because systemd can't execute scripts without shebang, and rc.local
is not run (`status=203/EXEC`).

Change-Id: Icc2f01b89e6d582ad015009f6916379bee8af7b9

commit_message:
Add options attribute to NFVSwitch

Adding options to NFVSwitch type bridge will give flexibility and
avoid specific attributes like 'cpus' in the yaml file (which will now
be moved into the options)

subject: [Gates] Unblock rally verify gates
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-05 14:29:59.000000000', 'files': ['rally/verification/tempest/config.py', 'tests/ci/rally_verify.py', 'rally/ui/templates/ci/index_verify.html'], 'message': '[Gates] Unblock rally verify gates

Three rally verify jenkins jobs

  gate-rally-dsvm-verify-full-discover-resources
  gate-rally-dsvm-verify-light-create-resources
  gate-rally-dsvm-verify-full-create-resources

fail very often because of the issue with the internet connection
on jenkins slaves. This patch is a temporary work around to unblock
rally verify gates and continue the development process further.

Change-Id: I1a301cd6ac0df8e33c8b06301f00dbbb2abc43bd
'}]
commit_message:
[Gates] Unblock rally verify gates

Three rally verify jenkins jobs

  gate-rally-dsvm-verify-full-discover-resources
  gate-rally-dsvm-verify-light-create-resources
  gate-rally-dsvm-verify-full-create-resources

fail very often because of the issue with the internet connection
on jenkins slaves. This patch is a temporary work around to unblock
rally verify gates and continue the development process further.

Change-Id: I1a301cd6ac0df8e33c8b06301f00dbbb2abc43bd

subject: Remove warning when no base venvs are found
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-05 16:40:45.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/repo_venv_pre_build.yml'], 'message': 'Remove warning when no base venvs are found

During the "Destroy base venvs to rebuild them" step ansible tries to
access base_venvs.stdout_lines. If no base_venvs have been registered
previously, this causes a deprecation warning because stdout_lines is
undefined.
This is a small fix to remove this warning by giving an empty list as
default value when stdout_lines is not defined.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I358709f3d4dc10a60f59976f1c4fbf87705def57
(cherry picked from commit 851e3ffd09544b655e20997a4e586452b7f6a583)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove warning when no base venvs are found

During the "Destroy base venvs to rebuild them" step ansible tries to
access base_venvs.stdout_lines. If no base_venvs have been registered
previously, this causes a deprecation warning because stdout_lines is
undefined.
This is a small fix to remove this warning by giving an empty list as
default value when stdout_lines is not defined.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I358709f3d4dc10a60f59976f1c4fbf87705def57
(cherry picked from commit 851e3ffd09544b655e20997a4e586452b7f6a583)

subject: Add "daily" option to bugdaystats.py
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-20 10:36:27.000000000', 'files': ['config.js.sample', 'README.rst', 'bugdaystats.py'], 'message': 'Add "daily" option to bugdaystats.py

Recently, we are triaging bugs of Tempest on the launchpad and that
work was fine to clean up old bugs and fixed bugs with different
patches.
Current bugdaystats shows it in last several days statically, and it
would be nice to add more long terms like in 30 days or a release to see
bug triage trends.

This patch adds a "daily" option to bugdaystats.py for making daily data
json files. The file can be used to show long term data in other graphs.

Change-Id: Ieac396389ce13468b717d03264164c77f7c36104
'}]
commit_message:
Add "daily" option to bugdaystats.py

Recently, we are triaging bugs of Tempest on the launchpad and that
work was fine to clean up old bugs and fixed bugs with different
patches.
Current bugdaystats shows it in last several days statically, and it
would be nice to add more long terms like in 30 days or a release to see
bug triage trends.

This patch adds a "daily" option to bugdaystats.py for making daily data
json files. The file can be used to show long term data in other graphs.

Change-Id: Ieac396389ce13468b717d03264164c77f7c36104

commit_message:
Do not use yaql input data conversion

When root is set to context manually it will not
be converted into immutable object and task serialization
will do faster because it does not spent time to this conversion

Related-Bug: 1569859
Change-Id: I46e4c43a757b78d96eec3edea0f66361afae3d73

commit_message:
Standardize the testing for Cinder

This PR standardizes the testing around the central tests repository:

* Removes the install-cinder and prepare-vg playbooks
* Moves the inventory settings into host_vars
* Adjusts the "bridges" settings
* Standardize IP addresses on the 10.1.1.0/24 range

Change-Id: I91c8079b033bb83e0175a3ab4b1c020a8df4a0db

commit_message:
Clean up requests-mock usage

In line with other clients testing we've found that having the
requests-mock fixture at self.requests can be misleading for new people
as it looks like you're calling requests itself.

Also make use of some of the new features of requests-mock like query
parsing, json handling, method names.

Change-Id: Id61b88c53478d49f91c3f880ed5b90d638051ba0

subject: Replace requests mocking with requests-mock
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-04 19:54:17.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/unit/utils.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/test_client.py'], 'message': 'Replace requests mocking with requests-mock

The novaclient tests are broken with the master (unreleased) branch of
requests. This is because most of the mocking that novaclient does with
requests in insufficient.

Requests-mock is for exactly this purpose and is already widely used in
novaclient so replace using mock with requests-mock where appropriate.

Closes-Bug: #1630157
Change-Id: Ie91daeb5f0c241eb83b77c04ac1b12e431d6671c
'}]
commit_message:
Replace requests mocking with requests-mock

The novaclient tests are broken with the master (unreleased) branch of
requests. This is because most of the mocking that novaclient does with
requests in insufficient.

Requests-mock is for exactly this purpose and is already widely used in
novaclient so replace using mock with requests-mock where appropriate.

Closes-Bug: #1630157
Change-Id: Ie91daeb5f0c241eb83b77c04ac1b12e431d6671c

subject: Remove warning when no base venvs are found
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-05 14:02:30.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/repo_venv_pre_build.yml'], 'message': 'Remove warning when no base venvs are found

During the "Destroy base venvs to rebuild them" step ansible tries to
access base_venvs.stdout_lines. If no base_venvs have been registered
previously, this causes a deprecation warning because stdout_lines is
undefined.
This is a small fix to remove this warning by giving an empty list as
default value when stdout_lines is not defined.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I358709f3d4dc10a60f59976f1c4fbf87705def57
'}]
commit_message:
Remove warning when no base venvs are found

During the "Destroy base venvs to rebuild them" step ansible tries to
access base_venvs.stdout_lines. If no base_venvs have been registered
previously, this causes a deprecation warning because stdout_lines is
undefined.
This is a small fix to remove this warning by giving an empty list as
default value when stdout_lines is not defined.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I358709f3d4dc10a60f59976f1c4fbf87705def57

Change-Id: Iff2d736415cfbe3e1ec60aa370cc30bd8610541d

commit_message:
Allow db user name differing from db name

For some services, the name of the database user may differ from the
name of the database that user needs access to. Add a 'db_user' variable
for use in this case, defaulting to 'db_name' to maintain current
functionality.

Change-Id: Iff2d736415cfbe3e1ec60aa370cc30bd8610541d

subject: Checksum all traffic traveling though the bridges
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-03 20:55:00.000000000', 'files': ['test-prepare-host.yml'], 'message': 'Checksum all traffic traveling though the bridges

Some tests requiring accessing OpenStack APIs from within a VM may fail
due to networking problems caused by invalid checksums. This change
simply changes the checksum rules from only port 22 to all ports.

Related-bug: #1619730
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: If2e6180ec999f09e89944faa0a2b195dd81fba0e
'}]
commit_message:
Checksum all traffic traveling though the bridges

Some tests requiring accessing OpenStack APIs from within a VM may fail
due to networking problems caused by invalid checksums. This change
simply changes the checksum rules from only port 22 to all ports.

Related-bug: #1619730
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: If2e6180ec999f09e89944faa0a2b195dd81fba0e

commit_message:
Remove workaround for bad pycparser wheel

This reverts https://review.openstack.org/381007 now that the
root cause of the issue [1] has been resolved, and that the
upper-constraints for OpenStack have been updated [2] to work
around the issue.

It also adds a clearer explanation for the reason why
libvirt-python is not installed via a wheel in tests.

[1] https://github.com/eliben/pycparser/issues/147
[2] https://review.openstack.org/381011

Change-Id: I2a4e75d952d4218fa7a0847e6fbf8f6afc15a65b

subject: Add linux-image-extra to host packages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-05 14:07:52.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Add linux-image-extra to host packages

When the host is installed, the loading of the kernel module
'vhost_net' may fail due to the module not being installed.

modprobe: FATAL: Module vhost_net not found.

This patch ensures that the appropriate linux-image-extra package

Change-Id: If2f008357117495c9e4b80dbfef68503fa93a809
Closes-Bug: 1595323

commit_message:
Add linux-image-extra to host packages

When the host is installed, the loading of the kernel module
'vhost_net' may fail due to the module not being installed.

This results in the following error when trying to load the
vhost_net module:

modprobe: FATAL: Module vhost_net not found.

This patch ensures that the appropriate linux-image-extra package
for the running kernel is installed.

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/335650
- https://review.openstack.org/382410

Change-Id: If2f008357117495c9e4b80dbfef68503fa93a809
Closes-Bug: 1595323

subject: Ensure that linux-image-extra matches running kernel
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-05 14:03:08.000000000', 'files': ['vars/ubuntu-14.04.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml'], 'message': "Ensure that linux-image-extra matches running kernel

When the host is installed, the loading of the kernel module
'vhost_net' may fail due to the module not being installed.

Currently the role installs the 'linux-image-extra-virtual'
package which will install the latest kernel and latest
extras package, but this may not match the running kernel on
the host.

This results in the following error when trying to load the
vhost_net module:

modprobe: FATAL: Module vhost_net not found.

This patch ensures that the linux-image-extra package
installed matches that of the running kernel.

Change-Id: I08271fcdfae3977f202ad7d6b03f61ab00e64370
(cherry picked from commit 23ad4822cc8822378ab1d64037b5eb722a1dedd3)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that linux-image-extra matches running kernel

When the host is installed, the loading of the kernel module
'vhost_net' may fail due to the module not being installed.

Currently the role installs the 'linux-image-extra-virtual'
package which will install the latest kernel and latest
extras package, but this may not match the running kernel on
the host.

This results in the following error when trying to load the
vhost_net module:

modprobe: FATAL: Module vhost_net not found.

This patch ensures that the linux-image-extra package
installed matches that of the running kernel.

Change-Id: I08271fcdfae3977f202ad7d6b03f61ab00e64370
(cherry picked from commit 23ad4822cc8822378ab1d64037b5eb722a1dedd3)

commit_message:
Moving of Nova scenarios into separate classes

Since current scenario implementation transforms method to class
at runtime, it is reasonable to have class-based scenario
implementation which will be much simpler to use behind the scenes.

This class should be based on Scenario and do not break compatibility.
The only required method is run() which is actually a body of scenario.

Change-Id: If6d69aa6b16d1aa3745422e772bca98e6c4eaf9a

commit_message:
Heka template missing optional params

If enable_rabbitmq or enable_keystone are false, the configs will not be
copied to target nodes for these. This resulted in Heka failing to
start.

Closes-Bug: #1630613

subject: Use service-specific servernames for haproxy
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-05 08:21:23.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'message': "Use service-specific servernames for haproxy

Right now we're hardcoding the server names for the services to be
the controllers. This is problematic if we start  using custom roles
for services, which listen on nodes that are not controllers.

We already have the server names for each service, so using this
mapping instead fixes the issue.

Change-Id: Ic4b65edb3dc1b75abbc3421a87cab97425b058c4
Closes-Bug: #1629098
"}]
commit_message:
Use service-specific servernames for haproxy

Right now we're hardcoding the server names for the services to be
the controllers. This is problematic if we start  using custom roles
for services, which listen on nodes that are not controllers.

We already have the server names for each service, so using this
mapping instead fixes the issue.

Change-Id: Ic4b65edb3dc1b75abbc3421a87cab97425b058c4
Closes-Bug: #1629098

subject: Time out port update waiting for vif plug
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-04 18:09:51.000000000', 'files': ['networking_powervm/plugins/ibm/agent/powervm/sriov_agent.py', 'networking_powervm/tests/unit/plugins/ibm/powervm/test_sriov_agent.py'], 'message': "Time out port update waiting for vif plug

When the SR-IOV agent receives a port update notice from neutron, it
polls the server waiting for the corresponding vNIC to be created before
marking the port as active.  If the vNIC create errors or doesn't
happen, the agent would keep polling for that vNIC indefinitely.

With this change set, if the vNIC doesn't spring into existence within
20 minutes, the agent gives up and stops polling.  (If whatever caused
the vNIC not to be created hasn't already triggered rollback/cleanup of
the corresponding compute process, that process also times out after 20
minutes.)

Closes-Bug: #1629559
Change-Id: I5fd640dfb799c51738aa3613852b4ac69decb31b
"}]
commit_message:
Time out port update waiting for vif plug

When the SR-IOV agent receives a port update notice from neutron, it
polls the server waiting for the corresponding vNIC to be created before
marking the port as active.  If the vNIC create errors or doesn't
happen, the agent would keep polling for that vNIC indefinitely.

With this change set, if the vNIC doesn't spring into existence within
20 minutes, the agent gives up and stops polling.  (If whatever caused
the vNIC not to be created hasn't already triggered rollback/cleanup of
the corresponding compute process, that process also times out after 20
minutes.)

Closes-Bug: #1629559
Change-Id: I5fd640dfb799c51738aa3613852b4ac69decb31b

commit_message:
Sort fixed_ips for ports

This is not really a substantial thing, because the order returned from
neutron is not defined and does not carry meaning. However, in
functional tests this has been on occasion unstable. So go ahead and
sort it because it's not hard. Also, this will put in a normalize hook
for ports which will be nice later.

Change-Id: Ifb79ded4bdf8ac095cca75894c3524268f9f97c5

commit_message:

As some of our utils function are actually available in oslo.utils,

the oslo.utils one. This will help us deport the code maintenance of
these to a 3rd party library.

subject: DevStack: disable Neutron compute services on initial node
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-05 14:08:32.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/settings'], 'message': 'DevStack: disable Neutron compute services on initial node

In DevStack tests against Neutron master and stable/newton, we're seeing
lots of error logs like these:

[req-47312e0f-d29c-4809-adb2-85ddd8be6bbe - -] Exception during message handling
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_messaging/rpc/server.py", line 133, in _process_incoming
    res = self.dispatcher.dispatch(message)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_messaging/rpc/dispatcher.py", line 150, in dispatch
    return self._do_dispatch(endpoint, method, ctxt, args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_messaging/rpc/dispatcher.py", line 121, in _do_dispatch
    result = func(ctxt, **new_args)
  File "/opt/stack/neutron/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/type_tunnel.py", line 398, in tunnel_sync
    raise exc.InvalidInput(error_message=msg)
InvalidInput: Invalid input for operation: Network type value 'vxlan' not supported.

But the processing needed in a deployment with Calico networking
shouldn't be going anywhere need the ML2 'tunnel' type driver...

Further investigation reveals that:
- the only caller of 'tunnel_sync' is the OVS agent
- neutron-openvswitch-agent is indeed running on the first node (with
  combined control/compute function) that is set up using
  networking-calico's DevStack settings
- other processes running, but that Calico doesn't actually want or
  need, are neutron-dhcp-agent, neutron-l3-agent and
  neutron-metadata-agent.

This commit disables those unwanted agents.

Change-Id: I510ab19bbea33739a6be1c0e727a0091edb4d9f0
'}]
commit_message:
DevStack: disable Neutron compute services on initial node

In DevStack tests against Neutron master and stable/newton, we're seeing
lots of error logs like these:

[req-47312e0f-d29c-4809-adb2-85ddd8be6bbe - -] Exception during message handling
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_messaging/rpc/server.py", line 133, in _process_incoming
    res = self.dispatcher.dispatch(message)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_messaging/rpc/dispatcher.py", line 150, in dispatch
    return self._do_dispatch(endpoint, method, ctxt, args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_messaging/rpc/dispatcher.py", line 121, in _do_dispatch
    result = func(ctxt, **new_args)
  File "/opt/stack/neutron/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/type_tunnel.py", line 398, in tunnel_sync
    raise exc.InvalidInput(error_message=msg)
InvalidInput: Invalid input for operation: Network type value 'vxlan' not supported.

But the processing needed in a deployment with Calico networking
shouldn't be going anywhere need the ML2 'tunnel' type driver...

Further investigation reveals that:
- the only caller of 'tunnel_sync' is the OVS agent
- neutron-openvswitch-agent is indeed running on the first node (with
  combined control/compute function) that is set up using
  networking-calico's DevStack settings
- other processes running, but that Calico doesn't actually want or
  need, are neutron-dhcp-agent, neutron-l3-agent and
  neutron-metadata-agent.

This commit disables those unwanted agents.

Change-Id: I510ab19bbea33739a6be1c0e727a0091edb4d9f0

subject: make the final release tool smarter
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-03 23:04:56.000000000', 'files': ['releasetools/gitutils.py', 'releasetools/cmds/propose_final_releases.py'], 'message': "make the final release tool smarter

For newton we had several projects with pre-release versioning this
cycle that didn't use it for mitaka. We also had several projects with
their first release this time around. Both conditions made
propose-final-releases suggest the wrong diff-start values. This patch
applies the rules that I used by hand to ensure that the diff-start
values in I74b66ffd484f2f3a2b84c39e62bcb718cef7b906 were
correct. Running the tool against a local copy of the releases
repository produced a patchset that was logically equivalent to I74b66.

Change-Id: Ib5025991d28e661c334e3ea81d256362fba5c0ff
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
make the final release tool smarter

For newton we had several projects with pre-release versioning this
cycle that didn't use it for mitaka. We also had several projects with
their first release this time around. Both conditions made
propose-final-releases suggest the wrong diff-start values. This patch
applies the rules that I used by hand to ensure that the diff-start
values in I74b66ffd484f2f3a2b84c39e62bcb718cef7b906 were
correct. Running the tool against a local copy of the releases
repository produced a patchset that was logically equivalent to I74b66.

Change-Id: Ib5025991d28e661c334e3ea81d256362fba5c0ff
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: make the script for proposing final releases more flexible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 16:02:01.000000000', 'files': ['releasetools/cmds/propose_final_releases.py'], 'message': "make the script for proposing final releases more flexible

We have a few deliverables in newton for which there are no release
candidates, but there are other pre-releases (betas) from which we want
to cut the final release. Make the logic for finding them more flexible.

The result will still assume that we want to diff from the rc1, which
won't exist, but those values were always just suggestions so we will
need to fix them by hand anyway.

Change-Id: I7fddbc5fec28eb1fe27ccfffa6e9a5126bc51dfd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
make the script for proposing final releases more flexible

We have a few deliverables in newton for which there are no release
candidates, but there are other pre-releases (betas) from which we want
to cut the final release. Make the logic for finding them more flexible.

The result will still assume that we want to diff from the rc1, which
won't exist, but those values were always just suggestions so we will
need to fix them by hand anyway.

Change-Id: I7fddbc5fec28eb1fe27ccfffa6e9a5126bc51dfd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Fix unit tests failure caused my fetch-mock update
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-04 14:23:26.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/keystoneTest.js', 'test/unit/util/abstractServiceTest.js', 'test/unit/glanceTest.js'], 'message': 'Fix unit tests failure caused my fetch-mock update

In some unit tests mockOptions.name was used instead of
mockOptions.matcher, and it was always undefined - this stopped
working with fetch-mock 5.5.0. This commit replaces
mockOptions.name with mockOptions.matcher where it is needed.

Change-Id: I367e1d957ce206c20c6b9d15c9f5ff1a2b285e33
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unit tests failure caused my fetch-mock update

In some unit tests mockOptions.name was used instead of
mockOptions.matcher, and it was always undefined - this stopped
working with fetch-mock 5.5.0. This commit replaces
mockOptions.name with mockOptions.matcher where it is needed.

Change-Id: I367e1d957ce206c20c6b9d15c9f5ff1a2b285e33

commit_message:
Update RDO repo url for stable/newton

https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-master will soon point to an
Ocata repository. For stable/newton, we can just switch the repo
URL to use centos7-newton, which is already available and has the
same contents.

Change-Id: Ia53f3b07f843986774b823c28aed6a0fe5908b10

commit_message:
Remove tempest.test usage from manila tests

Manila tempest tests should be independent from tempest code
as much as possible. The decorator test.attr is widely used in
all tests to set testcase attrs. This decorator doesn't
really do anyting else than calling testtools.testcase.attr.

Change-Id: If10beb9ae7562524f602a6fd7254aa95ef24d70e
Partially-Implements: bp tempest-no-deps

subject: Using assertIsNone() instead of assertIs(None, ..)
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-04 21:22:55.000000000', 'files': ['astara/test/unit/test_notifications.py', 'astara/test/unit/api/test_neutron_wrapper.py'], 'message': 'Using assertIsNone() instead of assertIs(None, ..)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..,None).

Change-Id: I72327e4c740ef11ee9cba4cda9642e4a270d1b52
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertIs(None, ..)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..,None).

Change-Id: I72327e4c740ef11ee9cba4cda9642e4a270d1b52

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-12 17:56:37.000000000', 'files': ['specs/approved/api-evolution.rst', 'specs/approved/evolve-driver-info.rst', 'specs/approved/evolve-error-responses.rst', 'specs/approved/evolve-etags.rst', 'specs/approved/evolve-discoverable-actions.rst'], 'message': "[WIP] API Evolution

This patch proposes several units of work, broken out into separate

This has grown out of the discussions around whether we should have a
'v2' API, and what current pain-points we all experience with the
current API. It is my belief, after investigating all of the collected
concerns, that we can implement many of the desired changes

NOTE: This is a work in progress, posted for early review of the
formatting and break-down of work. There are additional specs

commit_message:
[WIP] API Evolution

This patch proposes several units of work, broken out into separate
specifications for tracking, while also summarized into a single spec.

This has grown out of the discussions around whether we should have a
'v2' API, and what current pain-points we all experience with the
current API. It is my belief, after investigating all of the collected
concerns, that we can implement many of the desired changes
incrementally and without a full 'v2' rewrite.

NOTE: This is a work in progress, posted for early review of the
formatting and break-down of work. There are additional specs
that will be included in this before it is ready for full review.

*** WIP ***

Change-Id: Ic16378eb0c1b5a983872c3a9b0c21fab2116a708

subject: enable threading of batched writes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-30 19:49:04.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/rest/__init__.py', 'gnocchi/utils.py', 'gnocchi/service.py'], 'message': 'enable threading of batched writes

when adding measures for batch POST, we sequentially write each
metric and its measures. this is all IO and can be done with threads.

as benchmark, POST 50 batches, 20metrics each

1point/metric:
with threading: ~1.7109s (34.22ms/batch)
without: ~4.3594s (87.19ms/batch)

60points/metric:
with threading: ~4.9793s (99.59ms/batch)
without: ~7.1350s (142.7ms/batch)

720points/metric:
with threading: ~20.3034s (0.4061ms/batch)
without: ~21.7325 (0.4347ms/batch)

Change-Id: I8f49f6d69a7bf5ee348a9b243b596da73c844e97
'}]
commit_message:
enable threading of batched writes

when adding measures for batch POST, we sequentially write each
metric and its measures. this is all IO and can be done with threads.

as benchmark, POST 50 batches, 20metrics each

1point/metric:
with threading: ~1.7109s (34.22ms/batch)
without: ~4.3594s (87.19ms/batch)

60points/metric:
with threading: ~4.9793s (99.59ms/batch)
without: ~7.1350s (142.7ms/batch)

720points/metric:
with threading: ~20.3034s (0.4061ms/batch)
without: ~21.7325 (0.4347ms/batch)

Change-Id: I8f49f6d69a7bf5ee348a9b243b596da73c844e97

commit_message:
Python 3.x compatibility

[H234] assertEquals() logs a DeprecationWarning in Python 3.x, use assertEqual() instead.
The same goes for assertNotEquals().

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#python-3-x-compatibility

Change-Id: I0a5fdabcec9a08e26b9e00e05e543008d12c2363

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-09-29 14:47:57.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/common/aggregator.py', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/nagios_wrapper.py'], 'message': "Better truncating for nagios check detail

Previously special characters (such as '\n') would be counted as a single character
and later the string would be rejected when using the string repr which counts them as two.
This moves to a consistent approach for checking the value_meta length, similar
to how this is done in the agent aggregator

Change-Id: I9c148ca6d7da8ef8cc90638244ce24d1b149f6f6
"}]
commit_message:
Better truncating for nagios check detail

Previously special characters (such as '\n') would be counted as a single character
and later the string would be rejected when using the string repr which counts them as two.
This moves to a consistent approach for checking the value_meta length, similar
to how this is done in the agent aggregator

commit_message:
Don't pass argument sqlite_db in method set_defaults

Config option sqlite_db is deprecated for removal[1], and isn't
used in both oslo.db and Solum, so don't need set its default value.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/blob/\
0a1bae9859079fb21a03716be947c5f1da6db0a2/oslo_db/options.py#L17

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: I1e8f1aa2ae9bd8ced8e5410488517547f0b29779
Closes-Bug: #1552251

commit_message:
revise the "cluster-policy-attach"

The parameter "--enabled" in "cluster policy attach" is useless,
which can not be set to False.  Here we try to fix it so that
the parameter can be assigned to False when doing attach.

Change-Id: I0b5de3c6f61c38c62ac8c7e1b95d523175bbc11c
Closed-Bug: 1626833

subject: LLC Hook: Do not assume interfaces are added to Ironic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 15:47:09.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/test/unit/test_plugins_local_link_connection.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix_llc_port_assume-4ea47d26501bddc3.yaml', 'ironic_inspector/plugins/local_link_connection.py'], 'message': 'LLC Hook: Do not assume interfaces are added to Ironic

The current local_link_connection hook assumes that all inspected
interfaces are either added to or already exist in ironic as ports. When
CONF.processing.add_ports is set to PXE, and a node has more interfaces
than the one that we PXE on, then there will be more interfaces in the
inventory than added to Ironic. This patch ensures we must handle that
scenario.

Change-Id: I42c98c571ae8cfc26f319b712b5ac5bad88bb75d
Closes-Bug: #1628991
(cherry picked from commit c18d3cf45009b1751a5539eedccfa801ee183921)
'}]
commit_message:
LLC Hook: Do not assume interfaces are added to Ironic

The current local_link_connection hook assumes that all inspected
interfaces are either added to or already exist in ironic as ports. When
CONF.processing.add_ports is set to PXE, and a node has more interfaces
than the one that we PXE on, then there will be more interfaces in the
inventory than added to Ironic. This patch ensures we must handle that
scenario.

Change-Id: I42c98c571ae8cfc26f319b712b5ac5bad88bb75d
Closes-Bug: #1628991
(cherry picked from commit c18d3cf45009b1751a5539eedccfa801ee183921)

subject: Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-26 04:24:33.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/lp-cedarish/docker/swift-handler.py'], 'message': 'Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()

TrivialFix: Similar [1] in Kolla project
As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function. When they
are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the Python interpreter.
Therefore, when using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
may be more readable and reasonable.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/349353/

Change-Id: Ie4654b75892de025be73a17a76cdeac1f357ebbd
'}]
commit_message:
Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()

TrivialFix: Similar [1] in Kolla project
As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function. When they
are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the Python interpreter.
Therefore, when using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
may be more readable and reasonable.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/349353/

Change-Id: Ie4654b75892de025be73a17a76cdeac1f357ebbd

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function for astara
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-04 21:24:15.000000000', 'files': ['astara/test/unit/test_debug.py', 'astara/api/neutron.py', 'astara/common/linux/ip_lib.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function for astara

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result,but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you define
__eq__ for it to work properly.There are no implied relationships
among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y does not imply that
x!=y is false.Accordingly, when defining __eq__(), one should also
define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as expected.

Change-Id: I9859ad3bdf304ba87d04c9ecabf069b0fdfe4b45
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function for astara

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result,but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you define
__eq__ for it to work properly.There are no implied relationships
among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y does not imply that
x!=y is false.Accordingly, when defining __eq__(), one should also
define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as expected.

Change-Id: I9859ad3bdf304ba87d04c9ecabf069b0fdfe4b45

commit_message:
Fixing environment creation from template

Environment creation for env-template operation does not work
in python-muranoclient in multi-region testbed. This patch
allows for including region information in the request.

Closes-Bug: #1597715

This patch corrects a problem with the LLC hook's use
of the node_info.patch_port function, ensuring the correct data is
passed to the function, not a unicode string.

This patch also ensures that the mac addresses for chassis-id and
port-id are passed to ironic in the expected Unix format. Ironic will

Change-Id: Id5b729cd9e9beeb4f59ba6950162163d2fdf3a3a

(cherry picked from commit 20d941eeb15dcf20e3fd6a8eb2edef665211b356)

commit_message:
LLC Hook: Fix patching Ironic ports

This patch corrects a problem with the LLC hook's use
of the node_info.patch_port function, ensuring the correct data is
passed to the function, not a unicode string.

This patch also ensures that the mac addresses for chassis-id and
port-id are passed to ironic in the expected Unix format. Ironic will
fail to validate the mac addresses without this.

subject: Ensure that linux-image-extra matches running kernel
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-05 13:27:25.000000000', 'files': ['vars/ubuntu-14.04.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml'], 'message': "Ensure that linux-image-extra matches running kernel

When the host is installed, the loading of the kernel module
'vhost_net' may fail due to the module not being installed.

Currently the role installs the 'linux-image-extra-virtual'
package which will install the latest kernel and latest
extras package, but this may not match the running kernel on
the host.

This results in the following error when trying to load the
vhost_net module:

modprobe: FATAL: Module vhost_net not found.

This patch ensures that the linux-image-extra package
installed matches that of the running kernel.

Change-Id: I08271fcdfae3977f202ad7d6b03f61ab00e64370
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that linux-image-extra matches running kernel

When the host is installed, the loading of the kernel module
'vhost_net' may fail due to the module not being installed.

Currently the role installs the 'linux-image-extra-virtual'
package which will install the latest kernel and latest
extras package, but this may not match the running kernel on
the host.

This results in the following error when trying to load the
vhost_net module:

modprobe: FATAL: Module vhost_net not found.

This patch ensures that the linux-image-extra package
installed matches that of the running kernel.

Change-Id: I08271fcdfae3977f202ad7d6b03f61ab00e64370

commit_message:
tag keystone rc3 for newton

We found an upgrade bug late in newton and it will causes UUID
tokens to not be validated until all nodes are upgraded. Fernet
tokens are still fine.

Additionally, a fix for enforcing password history when PCI
support is enabled was also included.

Related Bug: 1630259
Related Bug: 1628692

Change-Id: I8fc7d7e0702f10a0eb53ee293e1cd0f41af4c45d

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-10-04 15:21:44.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/commands.py', 'neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/idlutils.py', 'neutron/agent/ovsdb/impl_vsctl.py', 'neutron/agent/ovsdb/impl_idl.py', 'neutron/agent/ovsdb/api.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/ovsdb/native/test_idlutils.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py'], 'message': 'Handle uuid references within an ovsdb transaction

Enable the OVSDB API implementations to handle referencing a newly
created object within the same transaction. For vsctl, this is via
the --id=@name construct. For native, this is via storing the
created row as the result, then replacing the result when the
transaction completes. This uses an api.Command object passed as
part of a column value in a db_set/db_create operation as a
reference to that object in a transaction. For example, do:

with self.ovsdb.transaction() as txn:
    queue = txn.add(self.ovsdb.db_create("Queue", ...))
    qos = txn.add(self.ovsdb.db_create("QoS", queues={0: queue}))
    port = txn.add(self.ovsdb.db_set("Port", pname, ('qos', qos)))

instead of having to do 5 separate transactions to: create a
queue, find the queue, create the QoS entry, find the QoS entry,
and finally to update the port with the QoS entry.

Change-Id: I1781794958af1483dabc0f5d17f2df6fea828564
Closes-Bug: #1615105
'}]
commit_message:
Handle uuid references within an ovsdb transaction

Enable the OVSDB API implementations to handle referencing a newly
created object within the same transaction. For vsctl, this is via
the --id=@name construct. For native, this is via storing the
created row as the result, then replacing the result when the
transaction completes. This uses an api.Command object passed as
part of a column value in a db_set/db_create operation as a
reference to that object in a transaction. For example, do:

with self.ovsdb.transaction() as txn:
    queue = txn.add(self.ovsdb.db_create("Queue", ...))
    qos = txn.add(self.ovsdb.db_create("QoS", queues={0: queue}))
    port = txn.add(self.ovsdb.db_set("Port", pname, ('qos', qos)))

instead of having to do 5 separate transactions to: create a
queue, find the queue, create the QoS entry, find the QoS entry,
and finally to update the port with the QoS entry.

Change-Id: I1781794958af1483dabc0f5d17f2df6fea828564
Closes-Bug: #1615105

commit_message:
Default to http://ftp.us.debian.org/debian for debian-minimal

Since http://httpredir.debian.org is unreliable is selecting a mirror
to use, we'll now default to http://ftp.us.debian.org/debian.  In
fact, in openstack-infra we have been overriding httpredir.debian.org
for a while, now make this default in diskimage-builder.

Change-Id: I48658bc076e13a0913821197e4120c73618fef8f
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Metadata storage in object model

Modified serializer/deserializer to load and persist the "metadata"
block of the ?-section of object model. Added a "metadata()" function
to read the value of this block for any object.

Targets-blueprint: metadata-assignment-and-propagation

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-10-04 22:52:33.000000000', 'files': ['HACKING.rst'], 'message': 'Clarify the guideline of negative tests

We have discussed negative tests at OpenStack Summit Austin before
as https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/newton-qa-negative-testing

The conclusion is
* Keep the existing negative tests
  Tempest should not cover all negative test cases as integration tests.
  Such tests should be covered with function tests in each projects.
  Function tests are implemented in Nova, [Ceilometer -> Gabbi], Barbican
  36 negative tests are used in Refstack as required tests and they are valuable

So we need some guideline about negative tests for our future, and this
patch adds it.

Change-Id: I2ac1a4cf91c9357caca2d490e6bc15699b7f3dad
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify the guideline of negative tests

We have discussed negative tests at OpenStack Summit Austin before
as https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/newton-qa-negative-testing

The conclusion is
* Keep the existing negative tests
  Tempest should not cover all negative test cases as integration tests.
  Such tests should be covered with function tests in each projects.
  Function tests are implemented in Nova, [Ceilometer -> Gabbi], Barbican
  36 negative tests are used in Refstack as required tests and they are valuable

So we need some guideline about negative tests for our future, and this
patch adds it.

Change-Id: I2ac1a4cf91c9357caca2d490e6bc15699b7f3dad

commit_message:
L3 DVR: always notify on ROUTER_INTERFACE AFTER_CREATE

With this change the L3 DVR code for add_router_interface
will always generate ROUTER_INTERFACE AFTER_CREATE notifications,
even in the absence of a gateway on the router.

Change-Id: I2eae49b06cad0c42950ac76f1db7ea6e37e308b9
Closes-Bug: 1629861

commit_message:
Fix SR-IOV qos extension calls to clear_rate functions.

New public functions are added to ESwitchManager class,
'clear_max_rate' and 'clear_min_tx_rate', instead of using
'_clear_rate' exposing the rate_type parameter. This
rate_type parameter could change in future releases only
modifying the Embedded Switch Manager.

Change-Id: Ib7046c87f3480ba8859d2d472fe154f1e3466d1b
Closes-Bug: 1621461

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-10-04 18:06:33.000000000', 'files': ['panko/tests/functional/api/v2/test_event_scenarios.py', 'panko/event/storage/impl_elasticsearch.py', 'panko/api/controllers/v2/events.py', 'panko/event/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py', 'panko/event/storage/pymongo_base.py', 'panko/storage/__init__.py', 'panko/api/controllers/v2/utils.py', 'panko/event/storage/base.py', 'panko/event/storage/models.py', 'panko/event/storage/impl_hbase.py'], 'message': "Enable paginate query for event listing

sorting and marker options are enabled for event listing (for sqlalchemy only)
using oslob.db.

    sort -- list of sorting criteria. Each sorting option has to format
            <sort key>:<sort direction>

            Valid sort keys: message_id, generated
            Valid sort directions: asc (ascending), desc (descending)
                    This defaults to asc if unspecified

            If sort list is unspecified, this defaults to
            ['generated:asc', 'message_id:asc']

    marker -- If specified, assumed to be an integer and assumed to be the
              message id of the last object on the previous page of the results

limit is still available and supported for non sqlalchemy databases

Closes-bug: #1615699
Change-Id: I0441ca6283be5859c09c3d381ffbb52ca4a79eca
"}]
commit_message:
Enable paginate query for event listing

sorting and marker options are enabled for event listing (for sqlalchemy only)
using oslob.db.

    sort -- list of sorting criteria. Each sorting option has to format
            <sort key>:<sort direction>

            Valid sort keys: message_id, generated
            Valid sort directions: asc (ascending), desc (descending)
                    This defaults to asc if unspecified

            If sort list is unspecified, this defaults to
            ['generated:asc', 'message_id:asc']

    marker -- If specified, assumed to be an integer and assumed to be the
              message id of the last object on the previous page of the results

limit is still available and supported for non sqlalchemy databases

Closes-bug: #1615699
Change-Id: I0441ca6283be5859c09c3d381ffbb52ca4a79eca

subject: Clean out UI httpd configuration file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-04 09:03:49.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/ui.pp'], 'message': "Clean out UI httpd configuration file

When updating the package with yum directly, a new httpd config file is
created with a different name than the one used by Puppet, causing
httpd to fail. Cleaning out the package config file and keeping it
around means it won't get overwritten on update, and is the way other
projects such as puppet-horizon handle this.

Change-Id: I539729ce4cd0898f8b0f3f26266e4e6d55b99e37
Closes-Bug: #1628983
(cherry picked from commit d86516383390f73134b427fe2e4627161840409f)
"}]
commit_message:
Clean out UI httpd configuration file

When updating the package with yum directly, a new httpd config file is
created with a different name than the one used by Puppet, causing
httpd to fail. Cleaning out the package config file and keeping it
around means it won't get overwritten on update, and is the way other
projects such as puppet-horizon handle this.

Change-Id: I539729ce4cd0898f8b0f3f26266e4e6d55b99e37
Closes-Bug: #1628983
(cherry picked from commit d86516383390f73134b427fe2e4627161840409f)

revisions:

We shouldn't need it any more, and the pip install line that this commit
removes conflicts with the 'python-etcd===0.4.3' that has
recently (since Newton) been added to OpenStack's global requirements.

Change-Id: Idb15e8900a957252646d777fbb78fd85cf470ec4
Sem-Ver: bugfix
"}]
commit_message:
DevStack: stop using Calico's python-etcd fork

We shouldn't need it any more, and the pip install line that this commit
removes conflicts with the 'python-etcd===0.4.3' that has
recently (since Newton) been added to OpenStack's global requirements.

Change-Id: Idb15e8900a957252646d777fbb78fd85cf470ec4
Sem-Ver: bugfix

times.

subject: Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-05 13:13:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted, we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Note: this copy from 1be35ff039d67c50866f2556ef847b048cbf3578

Change-Id: Ic19add9e016e82d2817e7f4a6eae5d4a9e77574e
'}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted, we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Note: this copy from 1be35ff039d67c50866f2556ef847b048cbf3578

Change-Id: Ic19add9e016e82d2817e7f4a6eae5d4a9e77574e

subject: TrivialFix: Using assertEqual instead of assertEquals
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-27 07:46:27.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_alarms_count.py'], 'message': 'TrivialFix: Using assertEqual instead of assertEquals

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H234] assertEquals() logs a DeprecationWarning in Python 3.x,
use assertEqual() instead. The same goes for assertNotEquals().

Change-Id: I87820c943b5a56564972cffc985a37a9e895d7e0
'}]
commit_message:
TrivialFix: Using assertEqual instead of assertEquals

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H234] assertEquals() logs a DeprecationWarning in Python 3.x,
use assertEqual() instead. The same goes for assertNotEquals().

Change-Id: I87820c943b5a56564972cffc985a37a9e895d7e0

subject: Cap requests as it conflicts with docker-py
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-04 13:30:55.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Cap requests as it conflicts with docker-py

docker-py has a cap on requests '< 2.11' [0], so current versions of them
conflict with each other. I've created a pull request there to fix this
problem [1] but in the mean time we should have consistent requirements.

[0] https://github.com/docker/docker-py/blob/1.10.3/setup.py#L12
[1] https://github.com/docker/docker-py/pull/1242

Change-Id: I0d09e671255a05219a389008956a4e8db2da9ac1
"}]
commit_message:
Cap requests as it conflicts with docker-py

docker-py has a cap on requests '< 2.11' [0], so current versions of them
conflict with each other. I've created a pull request there to fix this
problem [1] but in the mean time we should have consistent requirements.

[0] https://github.com/docker/docker-py/blob/1.10.3/setup.py#L12
[1] https://github.com/docker/docker-py/pull/1242

Change-Id: I0d09e671255a05219a389008956a4e8db2da9ac1

commit_message:
Prevent mixing bgpvpn associations

As mentioned in the spec, a router and one of its subnet
cannot be both attached to a bgpvpn.
This patch enforce this rule by adding a check when a subnet is
attached to a router.

Co-Authored-By: Wim De Clercq <wim.de_clercq@nuagenetworks.net>
Change-Id: Ie1f6a733e8a16b8b41e89c5a82637d7cb03bd423
Closes-bug: #1537067

commit_message:
Spec on capability to edit existing environment properties

The spec proposes mechanism for users to edit any details of an
existing environment, for example edit its regions, set home
region, change the networks or any other possible input field.

APIImpact
Targets-bp: environment-edit
Change-Id: I81d6799828deec9c8ba4345e5da157e47628e600

subject: Change rabbitmq queues HA mode from ha-all to ha-exactly
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6449, 'name': 'Chris Jones', 'email': 'cmsj@tenshu.net', 'username': 'cmsj'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 9257, 'name': 'John Eckersberg', 'email': 'jeckersb@redhat.com', 'username': 'jeckersb'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 19489, 'name': 'Peter Lemenkov', 'email': 'lemenkov@gmail.com'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-10-05 05:50:46.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/pacemaker/rabbitmq.pp'], 'message': 'Change rabbitmq queues HA mode from ha-all to ha-exactly

It turns out that reducing number of rabbitmq queues in cluster
significantly improves performance of cluster especially in the case of
failover recovery time. Right now the cluster uses ha-all mode for rabbitmq
queues.

It is best to change this to "ha-exactly" mode and reduce the number
of queue copies to ceil(N/2) where N is number of controllers in the
cluster - so in typical scenario of 3 controller It would be 2 by
default.

It does not make much sense to keep the copies of queues over whole
cluster since if the quorum of nodes is lost then the rest of cluster
nodes will be stopped anyway. We let the user override this with a
parameter.

I.e. for a 3 node controlplane cluster we will go from this:
pcs resource show rabbitmq
 Resource: rabbitmq (class=ocf provider=heartbeat type=rabbitmq-cluster)
  Attributes: set_policy="ha-all ^(?!amq\.).* {"ha-mode":"all"}"

To this:
pcs resource show rabbitmq
 Resource: rabbitmq (class=ocf provider=heartbeat type=rabbitmq-cluster)
  Attributes: set_policy="ha-all ^(?!amq\.).* {"ha-mode":"exactly","ha-params":2}"

According to Marin Krcmarik's testing recovery time from failure was
reduced significantly.

Co-Authored-By: Marian Krcmarik <mkrcmari@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib62001c03e1e08f58cf0c6e0ba07a8879a584084
Partial-Bug: #1628998
'}]
commit_message:
Change rabbitmq queues HA mode from ha-all to ha-exactly

It turns out that reducing number of rabbitmq queues in cluster
significantly improves performance of cluster especially in the case of
failover recovery time. Right now the cluster uses ha-all mode for rabbitmq
queues.

It is best to change this to "ha-exactly" mode and reduce the number
of queue copies to ceil(N/2) where N is number of controllers in the
cluster - so in typical scenario of 3 controller It would be 2 by
default.

It does not make much sense to keep the copies of queues over whole
cluster since if the quorum of nodes is lost then the rest of cluster
nodes will be stopped anyway. We let the user override this with a
parameter.

I.e. for a 3 node controlplane cluster we will go from this:
pcs resource show rabbitmq
 Resource: rabbitmq (class=ocf provider=heartbeat type=rabbitmq-cluster)
  Attributes: set_policy="ha-all ^(?!amq\.).* {"ha-mode":"all"}"

To this:
pcs resource show rabbitmq
 Resource: rabbitmq (class=ocf provider=heartbeat type=rabbitmq-cluster)
  Attributes: set_policy="ha-all ^(?!amq\.).* {"ha-mode":"exactly","ha-params":2}"

According to Marin Krcmarik's testing recovery time from failure was
reduced significantly.

Co-Authored-By: Marian Krcmarik <mkrcmari@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib62001c03e1e08f58cf0c6e0ba07a8879a584084
Partial-Bug: #1628998

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-10-05 09:45:03.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/tests/unit/services/bagpipe/test_bagpipe.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/bagpipe/bagpipe.py'], 'message': 'bagpipe: port+orig_port are in Port AFTER_UPDATE callbacks

ML2 code has for some time now been updated to provide both port and
original port information in Port AFTER_UPDATE notifications, in all
code paths.

We can thus simplify bagpipe driver and remove now-useless workarounds.

Change-Id: Ic46234261988ef8ec696e4788f1350e7a6608239
Partial-Bug: 1576440
'}]
commit_message:
bagpipe: port+orig_port are in Port AFTER_UPDATE callbacks

ML2 code has for some time now been updated to provide both port and
original port information in Port AFTER_UPDATE notifications, in all
code paths.

We can thus simplify bagpipe driver and remove now-useless workarounds.

Change-Id: Ic46234261988ef8ec696e4788f1350e7a6608239
Partial-Bug: 1576440

commit_message:
Update configuration reference link to latest draft

Currently, the configuration reference points to Mitaka. This is wrong
as Newton was just released. Additionally, there is also a different
page published from master.

This commit links to the "draft" page from master. This will direct
readers to the right version of the configuration reference
documentation.

Change-Id: I677bfe0757dd99b63c5204b36e5fe68878eeb1f0

commit_message:
fixed kestone fernet prechecks for multinode deployments

command fails since it is a compound command. Changed to a single awk
command instead.

Closes-Bug: #1629206

subject: Fix horizon to use cache
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-05 11:13:00.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/horizon/templates/local_settings.j2'], 'message': "Fix horizon to use cache

Horizon was missing SESSION_ENGINE from it's conf which means it was not
making use of memcached.

Change-Id: I450aee05f59e344902f1e92d913f4c1ce9e8dcc6
Closes-Bug: 1630509
"}]
commit_message:
Fix horizon to use cache

Horizon was missing SESSION_ENGINE from it's conf which means it was not
making use of memcached.

Change-Id: I450aee05f59e344902f1e92d913f4c1ce9e8dcc6
Closes-Bug: 1630509
